title: Obesity prevalence in England 2000 - 2018 , by gender
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Men, and Women. The y axis indicates the Percentage of obesity and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Men, and Women are gradually increasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Percentage of obesity in descending order is: 1. Women, and lastly, 2. Men.
Throughout the period, Women generally had the highest Percentage of obesity relative to others with an average of 25.0, and it reached its maximum at 2017 with a value of 30.0.
Men mostly had the least Percentage of obesity with a mean value of 23.95, which peaked at 2015, and 2017 with a value of 27.0.

max_summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Men, and Women. The y axis represents Percentage of obesity and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Men, and Women are gradually increasing,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Percentage of obesity in descending order is: 1. Women, and lastly, 2. Men.

The botommost line, Men,  has a mean of 23.95, and peaked at 2015, and 2017.
The greatest difference of Percentage of obesity between Men and Women occurs at Year 2014 and the smallest difference occurs at 2000.
